section.title: Document Information
section.para: This document provides information on the new user experience that Fusion Corporate Channels offers to corporate users in 5.5.6.0 version. The new dashboard is built using Angular. Fusion Corporate Channels consists of a set of modules (or functions) giving the corporate user online access to various services offered by the bank. Each module provides options to initiate transactions and follow through their life cycle. There are additional functions that provide enquiry, reporting and calendar management facilities.
The document also provides information on steps you need to perform to enable Modern Dashboard.

note.para: The availability of the menus and functions described in this document is dependent on the permissions assigned. Only those functions that you are authorized to use are available.

chapter.title: Enable Modern Dashboard
chapter.para: The bank is empowered to enable the Modern Dashboard for its corporate users. This chapter provides information on steps you need to perform to enable Modern Dashboard.

You need to perform the following steps to enable Fusion Corporate Channels modern dashboard for the corporate user.
Set the enable.fccui property to 'true' in fcc_ux.properties file.
Login as bank user and navigate to System Features > Customer Maintenance > Profiles
Click on an existing customer profile or "Add a new Customer" button at the bottom of the page.
Scroll down to "Type and Preferences" section, select the dashboard type from the "Dashboard Screen Type" field.
Classic Dashboard is selected by default.

chapter.title: Getting Started with Modern FCC
chapter.para: This chapter introduces the Web interface through which you use Modern Fusion Corporate Channels.

section.condition: TITLE=Services: Getting Started with Modern FCC;ACCESS=DB_UX_01
section.title: Welcome and Log In
section.para:
When you connect to Fusion Corporate Channels , a Welcome/Login page is displayed. Enter the provided credentials, Corporate ID, Username and password, then click Login.
When you are logging in for the first time, the Registration page is displayed. Read the terms and conditions, enter any required details for registration, and click Register to continue further.
Login Page

The Support link under the Login menu takes you to Finastra site. Fusion Corporate Channels offers the flexibility to change the URL address. The information on URL update is available in SDK documentation.

section.title: The Fusion Corporate Channels Client Landing Page
section.para:
Once authenticated, the product landing page is displayed. The page displays a list of cards based on user access. Click on any of the available cards to navigate to respective dashboard, like click on Trade Services card will take you to Trade Dashboard.
Fusion Corporate Channels supports Trade Dashboard and Cash Dashboard for the current release, click on other cards will redirect user to product feature page.
Product Landing page is an optional screen and can be disabled by checking the Don't show this Landing Page again! check box. You can enable the landing page again by checking the Show Landing Page check box in the User Profile Panel
on the Fusion Corporate Channels Dashboard.

The Landing page shown below is only for illustration purpose, the options available on the page are based on products licensed by customer. The image illustrates the complete portfolio of FCC offering.

The main landing area displays major products and functionalities offered by FCC, a brief description on each of the products and functionalities are listed below:
Dashboard - Displays the Fusion Corporate Channels global Dashboard.
Lending Services - Displays the Lending features page.
Account Services - Displays the Account Services menu.
Administration - Displays the Administration menu.
Treasurer FCC Dashboard - Displays the Power BI report, for details refer Power BI installation guide or contact Finastra.
Treasury Services - Displays the Treasury features page.
FSCM Services - Displays the FSCM features page.
Common Services - Displays the Common Services feature page.
Trade Services - Displays the Trade dashboard which shows transactions related to trade module.
Cash Services - Displays the Cash dashboard which shows transactions related to cash module.
For more information on each of these verticals, see the standard MP_user_client_en guide.

section.title: Configuring Client Landing Page
section.para:
This section guides the user to disable/enable the FCC Client Landing page.
The Landing page is enabled by default, the user can choose to disable the page.

To disable the FCC landing page, follow the instructions listed below:
Scroll down to the bottom of the Landing page.
Select the Don't show this landing page again! checkbox to disable the Landing page.
Logout of the current session and login to verify that the Landing page is disabled.

To enable the FCC landing page, follow the steps listed below:
Click User Profile Panel and select the Show Landing Page checkbox.
Logout of the current session and login to verify that the Landing page is enabled.
The Show Landing Page field is greyed out when the Landing page is already enabled.

section.title: The Fusion Corporate Channels Global Dashboard
section.para: Once you login, the Landing page is displayed. Click Dashboard to display the global dashboard screen. However, if the landing page is disabled, then the global dashboard is displayed as the first page after user authentication.

The Global Dashboard shown below is only for illustration purpose, the options available on the page are based on products licensed and the dashboard profile selected by the corporate user. The image illustrates the Standard Dashboard profile.
Each of the sections of the Fusion Corporate Channels Global Dashboard are listed here:

listitem.para: The Fusion Corporate Channels Banner
Navigation Bar
Dashboard Widgets
Personalize Dashboard

section.para: In many cases, there are multiple methods of navigating to specific functions or options. Some of these methods will be discussed in this guide.

The home

Logout:

Logout:
The Logout button to log out of the Fusion Corporate Channels.

section.para: As the banner is displayed on all pages, these options can be selected at any time.

section.title: Navigation Bar
section.para:
The Navigation Bar is displayed on all the pages below the Banner and it provides links to various functions and features of Fusion Corporate Channels. The list of features and functions are displayed based on your role and permissions.
The Toggle Menu in User Profile Panel enables/disables the navigation menu on FCC Dashboard.
The availability of the menus and their functions, is dependent on the permissions assigned to the user. Only those menus containing functions the user is authorised to use will be displayed.

section.title: Dashboard Widgets
section.para:
This section describes the various portlets that Modern Dashboard provides. A few portlets like Bills Outstanding, Loans Outstanding, Available Balance - Import and Available Balance - Export display the data in the following four graphical formats:
Pie Chart
Bar Chart
Logarithmic Chart
Grid View
Select the currency from dropdown to view the data representation in the desired currency.

section.title: Daily Authorization Limit
section.para: This portlet displays the daily authorization limit for the logged in user.

section.title: User Information
section.para: This portlet displays the overall account balance in the selected currency. Click View All Accounts to display the Account Summary screen, where you can search and view all the associated accounts.

section.title: Currency Wise Account Balance
section.para: This portlet displays the Currency Wise Account Balance in a list format. Click View All to display the Account Summary screen, where you can search and view all the associated accounts.

section.title: Mini Statement
section.para: This portlet allows you to download the Mini Statement. If there are multiple accounts, then you need to select the account for which you want the Mini Statement.

section.title: Transactions in Progress
section.para:
This portlet displays the list of all in-progress transactions from various modules. Click on any of the listed transaction to navigate to Edit Transactions of the respective module. Click on View All Transactions to navigate to Pending Transactions.
The roles and permission define the logged in user's right to view transaction of various modules. If the user is assigned Trade permissions then only Trade transactions can be viewed by the user.

section.title: Calendar
section.para: This portlet displays the calendar for the month and the current business date in your time zone is highlighted in violet text. The Calendar portlet also serves as an Events reminder to the logged in user. The date on which an event is scheduled is highlighted. Click on the highlighted date to view scheduled event/s on the date. Click the arrows beside the month name to navigate between previous and following months.
Here is a sample view of the calendar.

section.title: Currency Converter
section.para: This portlet enables you to check the amount in another currency. Select the From Currency and To Currency, enter the Amount, and the converted value is auto populated.

section.title: Pending Approvals
section.para: This portlet displays the list of all pending approvals. Click on the required transaction to display the Retrieved Unsigned screen, where you can take appropriate action. Click View All Transactions to display the My Pending Transactions List screen.

section.title: Exchange Rate
section.para: This portlet allows you to select a base currency from the list and displays the unit exchange rate. The exchange rate displayed in this portlet is indicative of the current rate set by the bank in Fusion Corporate Channels database.

section.title: Action Required
section.para: This portlet lists the transactions on which action is required. Click on the required transaction to display the Create Free Format Message for Import Letter of Credit (Action Required) screen and take appropriate action.
Click View All Transactions to navigate to Action Required screen.

section.title: DHL Tracking System
section.para: The Air Waybill Tracking link displays the DHL tracking website in a new tab. It allows you to track reports, notifications and/ or goods that you sent through DHL.

section.title: Bank News
section.para: The News Portlet allows the bank to post news and information to their customers.

section.title: Bills Outstanding
section.para: This portlet displays the outstanding bills in a graphical representation. It also displays the outstanding amount against each product of the module. Bills Outstanding

section.title: Loans Outstanding
section.para: This portlet displays the outstanding loans in graphical representation.

section.title: Available Balance - Import
section.para: This portlet displays graphical representation of the balance available against each product of Trade module. Available Balance - Import

section.title: Available Balance - Export
section.para: This portlet displays graphical representation of the balance available against each product of Trade module. Available Balance - Export

section.title: Bank Approvals
section.para:
This portlet displays polar representation of the bank approvals received in the last 15 days in various modules like Trade, Cash and so on. Click on View All Transactions to navigate to List of Transaction Notifications and search for transactions.
Bank Approvals

section.title: Bank Rejections
section.para:
This portlet displays polar representation of the bank rejections received in the last 15 days in various modules like Trade, Cash and so on. Click on View All Transactions to navigate to List of Transaction Notifications and search for transactions.
Bank Rejections

section.title: Dashboard Personalization
section.para: You can personalize the Fusion Corporate Channels dashboard to suit your requirements. Click Personalize and add or delete the portlet based on requirement. Once the modifications are made on the dashboard click Save. The saved dashboard can be viewed and selected from the User Profile Panel.

section.title: Feedback and Log Out
section.para:
When you log out of Fusion Corporate Channels, the Feedback Page is displayed. You are requested to rate your web experience on a scale of five, where five is the highest and one is the lowest. You can also share additional feedback in the text box. Feedback/Logout Page
The feedback you provide can be viewed by the authorized bank user.

section.title: Forgot Username or Password?
section.para: The 'Forgot Username or Password?' link under Login button enables you to reset the Password or retrieve your Username. Forgot Username or Password?

Click on the 'Forgot Username or Password?' link to open the Reset Password / Retrieve Username form. Ensure that you are on the right tab to Reset Password or Retrieve username and fill all the details. The individual fields of each tab are described in the following sections.

section.title: Reset Password
section.para: This tab enables you to reset password for your username. The following steps guide you to reset password.

listitem.para: Enter the mandatory fields Corporate ID, Username and E-mail ID with valid data. Forgot Password
Click on the reCAPTCHA checkbox to validate that you are a human.
Click on Next

Enter the the OTP (One Time Password) that you receive on your E-mail address on authentication page.
The OTP is valid only for 2 minutes, incase the time period expires the following message is displayed "The OTP is expired. Kindly regenerate the OTP and try again".
Authentication
Upon successful authentication, you are directed to 'Change Password' screen; enter the new password and Submit.

section.title: Retrieve Username
section.para: This section enables you to retrieve username. Follow the steps given below to retrieve username.

listitem.para: Enter the mandatory fields Corporate ID and E-mail ID with valid data. Retrieve Username
Click on the reCAPTCHA checkbox to validate that you are a human.
Click on Next, upon successful validation of data entered by you a success message is displayed.

section.title: Overview
section.para: Fusion Corporate Channels is customisable through dedicated property files stored under the ./config directory under the root of the webapp directory tree:

listitem.para: fcc_ux.properties is the master configuration file for Modern Dashboard customization. It specifies the other properties files to be loaded. The path to these properties files must be adjusted.

section.title: Naming Conventions
section.para: Configuration files use property-value pairs. Some standard prefixes are applied to properties to classify them:

listitem.para: .url when the property is a URL
.file when the property is a file
.directory when the property is a directory.
.classname when the property is a qualified Java class name.
.interval when the property is a time interval in seconds
All the file names path follow the Unix naming conventions (even if the application server is running on Windows), and are given relative to the webapp root.
The comment lines start with the character #.

section.title: Document Information
section.para:
This section provides information on common features that Fusion Corporate Channels offers to its corporate users. The common features available across products are listed below:
Lists
Forms
Date and Amount Formats
Forward and Back Browser Buttons Behaviour
Antivirus Scanning Service

section.title: Lists
section.para: Many functions display a page that lists relevant transactions. These list pages have many things in common:

listitem.para: You can enter search criteria in a group of fields at the top of the page and click Search , to make the list show only records that match these criteria. These fields represent the most important fields in the transaction record, as do the columns in the table.
You can use wild cards in these fields. The wild card character is an asterisk (*). You can use it anywhere in a field.
The search is not case sensitive.

On pages where the list might be very long - for example, if there are many transactions - the list is not displayed until you have entered the search criteria and clicked Search. Until manually specified, the list will display "No records found", just as it would if there actually were no records in the list.. Enter an asterisk in any of the search fields to get the entire list.
If your company has entities defined in its profile, then a column and a search criterion field for Entity appear in addition to the columns and fields mentioned in the individual chapters.
Each heading of a column can be clicked on, to make a triangular icon appear, which in turn can be clicked again, to sort the list on that column, in ascending or descending order.

In most lists, the individually entry in the list can be clicked, to process the transaction shown in that row. Depending on the list, transactions can sometimes be edited, viewed, deleted, or an amendment request created. Some lists allow the item to be clicked anywhere in the row, while others require the System ID column to be clicked, while others have icons for each actions. Details of list requirements are given in the sections for the individual functions.

section.title: Forms
section.para: Most functions display an input form, either immediately you click the function or after you click a row in a list displayed by the function. These forms have many things in common:

listitem.para:
Near the top right of a form, you'll see a free-floating menu on a coloured background, with the entries Show Form Summary and Top
. This menu stays put as you scroll up and down the form. Clicking Top takes the display back to the top of the form. Clicking Show Form Summary displays a menu of all the section headings in the form. These can be clicked to display the required section of the form.

Fields with a
(magnifying glass) icon to the right, indicate that by clicking the icon, a popup list of accepted values will be displayed. Click a value to insert it in the field. This is most often used for currency fields.

If a field has a
icon by it, clicking the icon will display popup list of predefined phrases. Click a phrase to insert it in the field. These fields can usually be edited further. This facility is most often used for free-format fields such as Other Information fields.
In some date fields, you can enter the date in two ways:
Select the first option button to enter the required date. Click the field and select the date from the calendar.
Select the second option button to enter a length of time. Insert the number of days/weeks/months/years in the first field. Select from the dropdown list: Days, Weeks, Months or Years.

section.para: This documentation describes each input form in detail, with a table describing each control (field, button, etc). The middle column in these tables contains symbols showing what type each control is, as follows:

row.entry: Input field with dropdown list to select from
Input field with button to display a popup list to select from

section.title: Date and Amount Formats
section.para: When entering a date in a date field, you can enter it in the form DD/MM/YYYY or DDMMYY if your locale is for instance France, or in the form MM/DD/YYYY or MMDDYY if your locale is for instance the USA..

informalexample.para: For example, entering 180401 produces a display of 18/04/2001, which in a French locale corresponds to 18th April 2001.

section.para: When you enter an amount, the system automatically formats the value entered according to the currency selected. You can either enter the amount using the decimal and group delimiters of your locale (for example, respectively [,] and [space] for France, or [.] and [,] for Singapore), or directly as a series of digits.

informalexample.para: For example, 123456.00 in a Singaporean locale produces a display of 123,456.00 if the currency involved is associated with 2 decimal places.

section.title: Forward and Back Browser Buttons Behaviour
section.para: When you use a Browser's Forward and Back buttons, the browser's default behaviour is displayed and Fusion Corporate Channels does not provide any customised messages.

section.title: Antivirus Scanning Service
section.para: This service provides an interface from Fusion Corporate Channels to an antivirus scanner of your company's choice. You can scan any attachment for viruses before uploading it from any transaction screen in Fusion Corporate Channels.

note.para: This service is enabled by the Fusion Corporate Channels Administrator.
